p.italic: n means number. Loss: ISSNHL without vertigo; Vertigo: ISSNHL with vertigo; PTA, pure tone audiometry; DHI, dizziness handicap inventory. p < 0.05 was considered statistically significant.
†P value was derived from Fisher’s Exact test. ‡ The comparison was between “No recovery” group and “Partial+Complete” recovery group and P value was derived from Fisher’s Exact test.

extracted-table.table-caption: Brain regions with significant FC differences between ISSNHL with vertigo and without vertigo group.

caption.p: Brain regions with significant FC differences between ISSNHL with vertigo and without vertigo group.

p.italic: Voxel number, T-values were obtained from the statistical parametric mapping of the ReHo (p < 0.001).
ROI-1 (MNI coordinate: -55/-26/12) and ROI-2 (MNI coordinate: 58/-25/16) served as the seeds for the FC calculation.
L means left brain; R means right brain; BA means Brodmann area.

extracted-table.table-caption: Summary of the characteristics of ISSNHL patients with vertigo.

caption.p: Summary of the characteristics of ISSNHL patients with vertigo.

p.italic: PTA, pure tone audiometry; ISSNHL, Idiopathic sudden sensorineural hearing loss; BCT, bithermal caloric test; cVEMP, cervical vestibular evoked myogenic potential; DHI, dizziness handicap inventory; “+”, abnormal of waveforms or results; “–”, normal waveforms or results; 0, no response; N, Test was not finished and terminated. ART, Acoustic Reflex Thresholds (ART) was a 3 frequency average (500, 1k, and 2k Hz) of the sensation level in dB HL; ipsi, ipsilesion; con, contralesion; “–”, absent. Spon-N, spontaneous nystamus; “–”, absent; R, right ear; L, left ear.
